BMW Indonesia akan Lokalkan X7, Investasi Ditambah
04 Nov 2019, 04:40 by Bisnis.com, Wawan Priyanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - BMW Group Indonesia akan menambah investasi pada tahun depan guna membangun fasilitas produksi untuk model BMW X7 agar bisa dirakit di dalam negeri.
Direktur Komunikasi BMW Group Indonesia Jodie O’tania mengatakan bahwa lini produksi baru tersebut membutuhkan biaya investasi yang cukup besar karena model tersebut belum pernah dirakit di Indonesia sebelumnya.
“Kalau untuk X7, memang model itu belum pernah dirakit di Indonesia, jadi pasti investasinya lebih signifikan di Indonesia, contohnya X5, itu sudah dirakit di sini, kalau nanti ada generasi barunya maka sudah ada teknologinya,” katanya kepada Bisnis belum lama ini.
Dia mengatakan bahwa mobil sport activity vehicle (SAV) tersebut mendapatkan respons positif sejak diperkenalkan di Indonesia pada Juli. Tingginya permintaan membuat BMW kehabisan stok dan calon pembeli harus menunggu hingga 6 bulan untuk mendapatkan unit tersebut.
Hal tersebut, lanjutnya, menjadi salah satu alasan utama BMW Indonesia berencana merakit kendaraan ini di dalam negeri, melalui pabrik milik PT Gaya Motor. Namun, dia menyatakan belum dapat memastikan kapan hal itu akan terealisasi.
Saat ini BMW sudah memiliki sejumlah tipe mobil yang dirakit di pabrik tersebut, antara lain BMW Seri 3, Seri 5, Seri 7, X1, X3, dan X5. Pabrik yang dibangun melalui kerja sama dengan anak usaha Astra International pada 2011 itu menelan investasi sekitar Rp250 miliar.
Dia mengatakan rencana perakitan model tersebut di Indonesia juga diharapkan dapat menurunkan harga mobil. Komponen harga yang lebih rendah diyakini akan membuat produk ini dapat diterima dengan lebih baik di dalam negeri.
VP Penjualan BMW Group Indonesia Bayu Riyanto menuturkan bahwa BMW Seri X memang menjadi salah satu primadona di Indonesia. Penjualannya diperkirakan mencapai sekitar 55 persen—60 persen dari total penjualan BMW di pasar domestik.
Dia mengatakan salah satu seri yang paling laku adalah Seri X1 yang juga dirakit di Indonesia. Penjulan model ini mencapai sekitar 40 persen dari total penjualan BMW. Model terbaru dari seri tersebut baru saja diluncurkan pada pekan lalu.
Bayu mengatakan peluncuran di akhir tahun diharapkan dapat menjadi salah satu pendorong pasar domestik pada 2019. Pihaknya sengaja merilis model itu pada akhir tahun untuk mengantisipasi kelesuan pasar pada paruh pertama tahun ini.

BMW Indonesia will Localize X7, Plus Investment
Nov 04 2019, 04:40 by Bisnis.com, Wawan Priyanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - BMW Group Indonesia will increase investment next year to build production facilities for the BMW X7 model so that it can be assembled domestically.
BMW Group Indonesia Communications Director Jodie Olandania said that the new production line required a substantial investment cost because the model had never been assembled in Indonesia before.
"For X7, the model has never been assembled in Indonesia, so surely the investment is more significant in Indonesia, for example X5, it has been assembled here, if later there is a new generation then there is technology," he told Bisnis recently.
He said that the sport activity vehicle (SAV) had received a positive response since it was introduced in Indonesia in July. High demand makes BMW out of stock and prospective buyers have to wait up to 6 months to get the unit.
This, he continued, is one of the main reasons BMW Indonesia plans to assemble this vehicle domestically, through a factory owned by PT Gaya Motor. However, he said he could not be sure when it would be realized.
At present BMW already has a number of types of cars assembled at the factory, including BMW 3 Series, 5 Series, 7 Series, X1, X3 and X5. The factory, which was built in collaboration with Astra International's subsidiary in 2011, has an investment of around Rp250 billion.
He said the plan to assemble the model in Indonesia was also expected to reduce the price of cars. The lower price component is believed to make this product better accepted domestically.
BMW Group Indonesia Sales VP Bayu Riyanto said that the BMW X Series has indeed become one of the prima donna in Indonesia. Sales are estimated to reach around 55 percent — 60 percent of BMW's total sales in the domestic market.
He said one of the best-selling series was the X1 Series which was also assembled in Indonesia. Sales of these models account for around 40 percent of BMW's total sales. The latest model of the series was just launched last week.
Bayu said the launch at the end of the year is expected to be one of the drivers of the domestic market in 2019. It deliberately released the model at the end of the year to anticipate market downturn in the first half of this year.
